content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function `clean_column` that accomplishes the task:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(replace(col, " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
 println(clean_column("My Column"))  # prints "my_column"
 println(clean_column("Hello - World"))  # prints "hello_world"
```

Alternatively, you can also use `replace` function with a regex pattern in a single line:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(strip(replace(replace(col, r"[ -]" => "_"), " " => "_")))
end
```

Or even simpler:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[ -]" => "_"))
end
```
